reviews.review_msg: Refused to give me an extension on an assignment even though I provided a doctor's note because he wanted more detail in the noteâ€¦.. I guess he doesn't believe in students having a reasonable right to privacy. Completely unsympathetic on top of being a monotone & unenthusiastic prof. I took 300W with him before this too and it sucked. Avoid him !
For an online class he was engaging and kind to the students. The midterms are online and are not too hard but still challenging. Loved the class super interesting material
You have to listen carefully to what he says on the lectures otherwise you will fail. Papers and assignments are marked harshly.

Weekly materials are heavier than other courses at similar level in my opinion. Criteria and outline is clear, lecture materials match the textbook, the exams are straight-forward but very shortly timed though. But reasonable since its open-book and all done online.

PSYC241 was awful & emotionally taxing. Despite the course concerning mental illnesses & neurodiversity, his course is designed in an inaccessible manner for neurodivergent students. He expects students to answer the exams coherently and comprehensively but does not give them the appropriate time to do so. Assignments are marked like it's PSYC300W.

DONT TAKE ONLINE. Took really interesting material and made it torture to learn. If u struggle with auditory retention these lectures are a nightmare. His delivery is monotone and so convoluted, sounds like he is reading straight from a textbook, but the lecture slides are useless so u have to focus hard on what he says. Had to rewind every word.

Doesn't want students to do well. Never accommodating to student's questions- no straight answer  Midterms and exam are extremely specific with  80 + pages to study for the exams. They gave us two topics in one week to make students self-teach to make up for the Reconciliation holiday. Doesn't post lectures and TA does not stick to office hours.

Terrible teacher, very monotone and his lectures are incredibly uninteresting even though I like this subject. His exams are the hardest I've taken and focus on specifics that are unrelated to the course. Very reliant on textbook. His powerpoints lack crucial information. Worst class I've taken thus far.
Very unclear marking rubric and a very difficult, tedious person to talk to. Lectures are just him reading off his notes for 3 hours straight.

Lectures can be dry and monotonous but they are extremely necessary to pass the class. This class may as well be called 'Analyzing Risk Assessments'. Lots of hard work and I didn't have much fun but Adam is cool and very knowledgeable.

Responsible, organised. Lecture content is a lot but he makes it easy and simple to understand. Lecture slides are easy to digest. Attending lectures will make sure you do good on quizzes and the final.
HW are worth 60%, even a 5% assignment takes forever to finish. Tutor grades all the assignments so your grade depends a lot on your tutor.

Dr Blanchard is a lovely prof! As long as you stay on top of the weekly topics and your research project you should do fine. There were a couple tricky writing assignments but I had a great TA who made those much more tolerable. Lectures are jam packed with information, and I managed to do fine on quizzes by just skimming the text book most weeks.

hard course, make sure you know your material (read the textbook and take notes). dr. blanchard does his best to make the lecture engaging and the material interesting. he's nice and all grading criteria were properly explained. the TA graded the writing assignments and research report and gave good feedback. go to the tutorials! [summer 2022]

This prof makes the topics clear and easy to go through, the TA's can make or break the class but definitely take it upon yourself to stay on top of the weeks and ensure you know what each week entails as this class goes very fast after the first midterm. Adam does his part by being accessible anytime needed and posts video lectures to refer to.

The exams in this class are disproportionately difficult and ask too many questions that are worded weird in a small amount of time. Our final exam average was 55 percent! Lectures are very heavy and you definitely need to attend. The only reason people are able to get a decent grade is cuz it's curved and the assignments

This is one of the best profs I've ever taken. Lectures are very detailed and interesting, although are 2 hrs long. The quizzes and assignments are fairly easy if you learn the material. Midterm and final exams were fair. Prof is quick at responding to emails and gives detailed responses. I would 100% recommend this prof for psyc 210.

his assignments and quiz's saved my grades. exams were much harder than they needed to be. Exam wording was so weird and hard to understand in a time crunch. keep up with the lecture and tutorials and text. Go to tut even if participation isn't marked. it saved me!

Dr. Blanchard made this intimidating class very manageable. Being someone who has not done math since high school, I was worried. No breaks in lecture, so they can feel long, but he explains everything clearly and is very organized. Assignments were a good way to show understanding and save your grade if you are not great under a time crunch!

Despite not doing the best in the class, it was not at fault from Adam. He is a good prof and explains the topics very well. There are weekly quizzes. The content can be difficult, but if you keep up and make sure not to fall behind in the class then you'll do fine.

Adam is a really slow talker but he has his recordings are prerecorded so you can put it on 2x, trust me, he's very very very slow. But aside from that, he's honestly such a caring and great prof! His lectures are amazing and super clear. He gives example exams before the exams too!

I really enjoyed taking psyc 379 with this great prof. he is really knowledgeable not only about the course content but also about how to clearly teach them to the students. He is definitely one of the best prof at SFU , and I would take more courses with him.

Dr. Blanchard is a great prof! His lectures can be a bit dry but really informative - AND HE PRE-RECORDED IT which was great. Exams are medium difficulty and so as the paper. Online discussions via canvas is also an easy mark to get. Easily one of the best profs I ever had although it was remote learning.

Had Adam for PSYC210 in the Spring 2020 semester and he was great! For someone who hasnt done any math since high school, Adam really made this course a breeze! My friend and I both got an A- and we happily shocked. Definitely a harder class, but if you put the work in, youll get a good grade!

Adam was an amazing professor, his lectures were straight to the point and he included many examples. The textbook was really important in expanding on lecture material so be sure to go through that. The class is hardwork but if you do the practice questions every week you can easily succeed. He also gives no breaks in a 2 hour lecture so be ready!
